comments:
I20060512-0010

org.eclipse.jdt.ui.tests.refactoring.RenamePackageTests.test3 fails as the resource delta computed before the change (using the ResourceChangeDescriptionFactory) contains the same file delete twice.


TestModelProvider.assertTrue(expected, actual) tests that the
resource delta that can be received after applying the changed (expected)
if the same as the resource delta compted ahead (actual).
Very likely a regression caused by fixing bug 140564.

Created an attachment (id=41308)
Fix

Michael, can you rerun the refactoring tests with this fix?  I'm running the resource tests...

I have run the JDT refactoring tests and got the following failure (all other tests passed). It doesn't look related to change validation. Can someone on JDT explain what this error means and confirm that it is not relatd to change validation?

I tested performance with the new patch when deleting a project with 10,000 resources (original bug), and this patch is about the same in performance (about 50ms to generate the delta). Use of hash maps will make the validation delta slightly larger, but it will still be proportional to the size of the change.

Created an attachment (id=41329)
Even better fix

This update just adds more comments, and sets the initial size of the child hashset to be small to avoid wasting space.
Fix released and tagged for rebuild.
The InlineMethodTests doesn't seem related to these changes. Might be something in your setup.
Just checked out the latest from HEAD and the test was green.
